page.title: 08LANDSCAPE - NORTH TAWTON
page.content: {St.Peter's Parish Church }is probably the oldest building in North Tawton. parts of the church ie)the tower are probably 12th century.The walls are exceptionally thick and are built of rubble and granite.The spire is made of wood and clad in oak shingles.{ {Cottles Barton} an Elizabethan Manor House built by the Cottle family in 1672.Granite and sandstone with thatched roof a fine example of this period.{Lakeway}_ North Street _ until a fire in 1891 a complete row of thatched cob cottages.These remain although not thatched.{Burton Hall}_ a large wooden house brought from Norway in sections and erected in 1870.The Holmes,_Fore Street_a good example of 18th century Domestic architecture. {Bouchers Close and Gostwyk Close}_ are the newest estate developments in North Tawton:built of concrete blocks.
